freetext: The weighted indium cross section resulting from
normalization at 30 keV was defined. (see REL-REF)
* The capture cross section of indium at 65 keV was
obtained by measuring the ratio of the 65 to 30 keV
cross sections.
* The indium capture cross section at 167 keV was
determined by normalizing the relative indium cross
section versus neutron energy curve at 30 and 65 keV
and reading the value as measured by the shape of the
U-235 absorption cross section.
An estimated typical standard deviation.
It includes:
The absolute (standard deviation) error in the
value of the cross section standard at has been
indicated to be about 6%. (The weighted indium cross
section resulting from normalization at 30 keV as
described in the article)
* For the measurement of the cross section of other
samples relative to the indium standard, at the
threshold energies, 30 and 65 keV, other sources
of error must be considered:
The error in the determination of the net area
under the time spectrum peak is estimated to be about
5% except where noted.
The uncertainties in calculating the R.S.P.
(resonance self-protection) correction for the sample
the relative to indium, as discussed in Appendix III
of article (PR,122,182,1961) , are estimated to be
of order 2%.
The uncertainties in the tank efficiency for
a sample as compared to indium are determined by two
considerations. The total efficiency error is
assigned to be 5%.
The uncertainty in the average path-length
correction as discussed in Appendix II of the article
* The uncertainties in sample weight and geometry
are negligible.
The best five of these measurements, with their
standard deviations, were used to provide normalization
for the present experiment in the following manner:
The capture tank measurements of the shapes of the
five cross sections as a function of neutron energy
were used to extend the spherical shell cross
sections to 30 keV. Then shell transmission
measurements compared with capture tank results.
